intro: Cotula coronopifolia var. integrifolia, commonly known as the Cape daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its small, daisy-like yellow flowers and hairy, lobed leaves. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It is a perennial herb that produces numerous small flowers throughout the growing season. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening and ecological restoration projects.
